column4: Can someone help me...I want to be able to access my linux box from work, so I can play around with it instead of...ya know...doing work :)
At work, we have a firewall that only allows outgoing connections from the web proxy server
So I can use IE to surf the net, but I can't ssh to my computer
Can someone help me come up with a solution that would let me, at least, get ssh/telnet access to my box remotely
you're getting something backwards... if you're only allowed web acess through a proxy, you *won't* be able to use SSH *at all*
the only way would be to have a fake web site that is actually a connection to your terminal.
how would you pass plain text via telnet, if all you have is an HTTP proxy?
but then you don't really need ssh or telnet, do you?
Do you know of any like 'pre-configured' web packages or something that would do that though?
i see no need for that kind of intermediate passage -- just have your own computer act as a web server, no?
no, i don't, and i even doubt you'll find any

well it would actually be quite simple to do with either apache or some simpler web server - but i'm not much into that kind of thing. still, all you need is a perl/php/whatever script that calls a system command (the system command being passed as a GET or POST parameter in the URL)
